projectPurpose: To serve as a modern, automated tool for conducting 802.11 wireless network penetration testing and security auditing, specifically focusing on capturing handshake data for offline password cracking and identifying network vulnerabilities.
mainFeatures: Active state-based attack engine for EAPOL message and PMKID retrieval
Targeting and whitelisting of networks (MAC or SSID)
Auto Hunt capability to scan across channels
Terminal-UI and headless operating modes
EAPOL 4-Way-Handshake validation and controlled deauthentication
Output in pcapng and kismetdb formats with optional embedded GPS data

alternatives.name: Aircrack-ng
mainFeatures: Packet capture and export
Attacking (Replay attacks, deauthentication, fake APs)
Testing WiFi cards and drivers
Cracking WEP and WPA/WPA2 PSK keys

alternatives.name: Kismet
mainFeatures: Passive wireless network detection and sniffing
Identifies networks, clients, and hidden SSIDs
Basic wireless intrusion detection system (IDS)
Logs captured packets in various formats (including pcap/tcpdump and kismetdb)
Supports multiple radio types (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Zigbee, etc.)

alternatives.name: Hashcat
mainFeatures: World's fastest password cracker
Supports numerous hashing algorithms, including WPA/WPA2
Multi-GPU and multi-CPU support
Various attack modes (dictionary, brute-force, hybrid, etc.)
Supports distributed cracking

alternatives.name: Reaver
mainFeatures: Brute-force attack against WPS (Wi-Fi Protected Setup)
Recovers WPA/WPA2 passphrases via WPS PINs
Automated attack process
Supports a variety of WPS routers

alternatives.name: Wifiphisher
mainFeatures: Automated rogue access point creation
Wi-Fi phishing attacks (Evil Twin, KARMA, Known Beacons)
Credential harvesting
Malware infection capabilities
Customizable phishing templates

marketPositioning: AngryOxide positions itself as a modern, Rust-based, and highly automated tool for 802.11 penetration testing, with a specific focus on efficiently capturing EAPOL handshakes and PMKIDs for offline cracking. Compared to the Aircrack-ng suite, which offers a broader range of tools requiring manual chaining, AngryOxide aims for a more integrated and streamlined workflow from scanning to handshake capture. While tools like Kismet focus on passive monitoring and discovery, AngryOxide actively performs attacks. Its unique features like EAPOL validation, GPS integration, and Kismet-compatible output, combined with its focus on automation and a modern codebase, position it as a specialized, user-friendly alternative for security professionals and hobbyists focused on Wi-Fi password cracking preparation and network vulnerability identification.
